Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture that shows how ice changes to water when heated.
The student can include in the drawing how water can change back to ice when cooled.
The student can distinguish between reversible changes like ice melting and changes that cannot be reversed (e.g., a cooked egg).
The student can show the characteristics of the material before and after heating or cooling.
The student can represent the cause (heating or cooling) and the effect (change in state) in their drawing.
